Manx: Creg dy eashyn son aym brish,
English: Rock of Ages, cleft for me,
Let me hide myself in Thee;

Manx: Lhig da’n ushtey as yn uill,
English: Let the water and the blood,
From Thy riven side which flowed,
Not the labor of my hands
Notes: [1] This line replaces the crossed out line: [Bee jeh peccah lheihys lane].

English: Could my zeal no respite know,

Manx: She Oo Hene shegin sauail mish,
English: Thou must save, and save by grace.

Manx: Fegooish gioot sy theill shoh wass,
English: Nothing in my hands I bring,
Simply to Thy cross I cling;

Manx: Chouds v’em tayrn yn ennal faase,
English: While I draw this fleeting breath,

Manx: As my hooillyn jeih ayns baase,
English: When mine eyes shall close in death,

Manx: Troggal er gys seihll gyn oayl,
English: When I soar to worlds unknown,
See Thee on Thy judgment throne,

Manx: Creg dy easyn son aym brisht,
English: Rock of Ages, cleft for me,
Let me hide myself in Thee.
